DOC.brief_summary: The study is a prospective, randomised, controlled, and non-blinded multi-center pilot study to evaluate endocrine efficacy of recombinant luteinizing hormone versus recombinant human chorionic gonadotropin administered during controlled ovarian stimulation for IVF/ICSI in normogonadotrophic women.
DOC.brief_title: Study to Examine Effect of Recombinant Luteinizing Hormone (r-Lh) and Recombinant Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (r-hCG) for Ovarian Stimulation in Assisted Reproduction Techniques (ART)
DOC.criteria: Women who plan to undergo IVF or ICSI treatment Woman's age > 18 years but â‰¤ 35 years Regular menstrual cycle (2534 days) BMI 18 to 30 inclusive Signed patient information and informed consent forms PCOS More than 2 prior IVF/ICSI attempts Diabetes mellitus, epilepsy, lever, kidney, heart and metabolism disorders, according to the Investigator's assessment.
